column5: Assume the price of gas and the weak dollar vs the loonie has hurt the tourism trade in NW Ontario. Given that assumption does anyone think it will be easier to get thru customs with a past DUI or will it be about the same as always. In other words will they let someone in that may have been turned around in past years?
I'll take that is same as always
I can't imagine it being different.

I'd say that if anything the issue of DUI's would be addressed more closely. If there are fewer cars crossing, the agents will have less pressure to keep the lines moving. There is no way I would attempt crossing with a DUI if I hadn't done the paperwork ahead of time. Long drive home for nothing.
I guess my thought was that at times law enforcement is stepped upped or relaxed depending on circumstances. Apparently not in the case of entry into Canada
